name: Stirling Moss
introduction: Sir Stirling Craufurd Moss, OBE  (born 17 September 1929, died April 12 2020) was a British Formula One driver.  He is regarded by many as 'the greatest driver not to win the world championship', having come second in the championship in 1955, 1956, 1957 and 1958.  He was also third in the championship in 1959, 1960 and 1961, before retiring after entering a coma due to an accident in 1962.
